quotes.text: He who knows, does not speak. He who speaks, does not know.
quotes.author: - Lao Tzu

quotes.text: Children are natural Zen masters; their world is brand new in each and every moment.
quotes.author: - John Bradshaw

quotes.text: There is one thing: above, it supports Heaven; below, it upholds Earth. It is black like lacquer, always actively functioning.
quotes.author: - Tung-shan Ling-chia

quotes.text: What is inexpressible is inexhaustible in its use.
quotes.author: - Unknown Chinese Zen Master

quotes.text: You are that vast thing you see far, far off with great telescopes.
quotes.author: - Alan Watts

quotes.text: Zen opens a man's eyes to the greatest mystery as it is daily and, hourly performed; it enlarges the heart to embrace eternity of time and infinity of space in its every palpitation; it makes us live in the world as if walking in the garden of Eden
quotes.author: - D.T. Suzuki

quotes.text: Zen is not some kind of excitement, but concentration on our usual everyday routine.
quotes.author: - Shunryu Suzuki

quotes.text: For Zen, man is the goal; man is the end unto himself. God is not something above humanity, God is something hidden within humanity. Man is carrying God in himself as a potentiality.
quotes.author: - Osho

quotes.text: You should study not only that you become a mother when your child is born, but also that you become a child.
quotes.author: - Dogen Zenji

quotes.text: If you're afraid of being grabbed by God, don't look at a wall. Definitely don't sit still.
quotes.author: - Jiyu Kennet

quotes.text: The fundamental delusion of humanity is to suppose that I am here and you are out there.
quotes.author: - Yasutani Roshi

quotes.text: Water which is too pure has no fish.
quotes.author: - Hong Zichen

koans.title: A Philosopher Asks Buddha
koans.text: A philosopher asked Buddha: `Without words, without the wordless, will you you tell me truth?' The Buddha kept silent. The philosopher bowed and thanked the Buddha, saying: 'With your loving kindness I have cleared away my delusions and entered the true path.'After the philosopher had gone, Ananda asked the Buddha what he had attained. The Buddha replied, 'A good horse runs even at the shadow of the whip.'
koans.source: source - The Gateless Gate (13th Century China)
